meanings.definition: The plural form of umbilicus, referring to the navel or belly button.
meanings.sent1: She gently touched her newborn's umbilicuses.
meanings.sent2: The doctor checked the baby's umbilicuses to ensure it was healing well.
meanings.sent3: The toddler giggled when she saw her brother's umbilicuses.
meanings.sent4: The dancer's costume had a sparkling jewel right above her umbilicuses.
meanings.sent5: In some cultures, people believe rubbing oil on the umbilicuses brings good luck.

meanings.definition: The point on a surface where the normal curvature is zero in all directions.
meanings.sent1: The mathematician studied the umbilicuses of the curved surface.
meanings.sent2: The artist carefully painted the umbilicuses of the sphere to create a realistic effect.
meanings.sent3: The cat sat right on the book, unknowingly covering the page discussing umbilicuses.
meanings.sent4: The calm lake reflected the sky like an umbilicuses of tranquility.
meanings.sent5: The scientist pointed to the umbilicuses on the graph, explaining its significance.
